featured.text: According to the article, which of the following is TRUE about medicines for colds? (A) They can cure the common cold.
A second kind of medicine is called “natural cures,” or “folk medicine,” in which less educated people try to cure sicknesses with various herbs.
Although nowadays it is successful, in the ancient world this approach probably did not cure many patients.
Other times, a magician may make you a magic charm, or say a spell, to cure you.
Recent research has found lots of evidence to the drug company’s claims about its “miracle” tablets for curing cancer.

other.text: According to the passage, which of the following statements is true? (A) Folk healers choose different herbs to cure diseases without any sound basis.
Surprisingly, only 51 percent of the people surveyed understand that the common cold has no cure.

definition.zh_def: 治療，療法；使康復或痊癒的過程或方法。
definition.en_def: To relieve a person or animal of the symptoms of a disease or condition; to restore to health.
definition.example: The doctor was able to cure the patient of her illness.
